content.text: Join us to explore and celebrate how our brains think, explore and imagine. In these family events, come and celebrate the diversity of our brains and through a range of activities, understand how we all differ in how we like like to think, learn and explore. Through coding, virtual reality, circuits and sound orchestras, pop-up performances, making and tinkering with immersive environments, you'll exploring the mind through your senses, body, movement and emotions.

On the Friday session, the BBC’s CAPE crusaders will join in for an Our Brains and Our Futures session. Explore everyday challenges in new and unexpected ways; you may even discover your very own super power during the turbo charged future focused, fantastical making and creative problem solving extravaganza.

These sessions are run by the Institute of Imagination, a charity creating space for children to re-imagine the world. Their goal is to spark imaginations everywhere and encourage creative learning through events, training, partnerships and research.

You'll find us on Level 5 in the The Hub, a dynamic interdisciplinary research space where people from different backgrounds and with a range of expertise collaborate on projects exploring medicine, life and art. You can take the lift or the stairs from the ground floor.

eventbriteEvent.title: Our Brains and Us at the The Hub at Wellcome Collection
eventbriteEvent.html:
Our Brains and Us at the The Hub at Wellcome Collection

You’re invited to…Our Brains and Us at the The Hub at the Wellcome Collection Join us at The Hub at the Wellcome Collection where we’ll be exploring and celebrating how our brains think, explore and imagine.  There’s not one human in the world that thinks in exactly the same way. At these family events we’re inviting everyone to come and celebrate the diversity of our brains and through a range of activities, understand how we all differ in how we like like to think, learn and explore. Through coding, virtual reality, circuits and sound orchestras, pop up performances, making and tinkering with immersive environments, we’ll be exploring the mind through your senses, body, movement and emotions.  When is Our Brains and Us? You can attend in the morning or afternoon on 25, 26 and 27 July. You can book for the morning, 10:00am – 12:30pm or afternoon 1:30-4:00 on each day. You can drop in anytime within the time slot you book for. We encourage you to register in advance, to ensure you get a place. You will need to register everyone in your group for a tickey. Who is Our Brains and Us for and how much does it cost? These sessions are for all families, children and adults. Tickets for this event are free and you can register in advance. Spaces are limited, so we encourage you to register in advance for your place. How to find us? We're running these events at The Hub at Wellcome Collection, 183 Euston Road, London, NW1 2BE, UK. Please visit The Wellcome Collection website for travel information.

content.text: These sessions are for all families, children and adults. Please ensure you register everyone in your group for a ticket. You can drop in anytime within the time slot you book for.
Bring the family for a fun day exploring our brains in The Hub at Wellcome Collection.
